speaker: Verso
line: … for about two hours then there’s a big lake. We shouldn’t go there. At all. Like it’s- We should make a right and then it’s going to take a few hours, and then we make a stop, we get some rest and some food, and then from there, we head north to Monoco’s Station.

speaker: Lune
line: Why there?

speaker: Verso
line: To recruit my oldest friend. We’ll need the extra firepower, because our next goal will be to take down the Paintress’ heart.

speaker: Sciel
line: Her heart?

speaker: Verso
line: Yes. You can’t just stroll up to the Paintress. The Chroma there is far too dense, it erases anyone who gets close. But if we destroy her heart, the barrier will fall.

speaker: Lune
line: Ok. So where is this heart? What does it look like?

speaker: Verso
line: What does it look like? That, I don’t know. But I do know that it’s somewhere in the centre of Old Lumière.

speaker: Sciel
line: You found Old Lumière?

speaker: Verso
line: Yes.

speaker: Lune
line: So it’s true. Before the Fracture, our Lumière was part of a larger city on the continent.

speaker: Verso
line: I’ve travelled with many Expeditions. I was with the 58s when we found Old Lumière. But Renoir erased them, before we could get further. And I don’t know much more.

speaker: Lune
line: Alright then. Let’s go meet your friend at Monoco’s Station. And then we’ll take the Paintress’ heart.

speaker: Sciel
line: How far up the mountain is Monoco’s Station? Will we see snow?

speaker: Verso
line: Not too high but yeah, there’s usually snow.

speaker: Sciel
line: Ah, fantastic!

speaker: Verso
line: Oh, right, there’s no snow in Lumière.

speaker: Sciel
line: No, only in books and paintings; it’s almost as mythical as gestrals!

speaker: Verso
line: And just as fun. And sometimes just as deadly.

speaker: Sciel
line: Oh, really? My husband was obsessed with the idea of snow. I can’t wait to see some.

speaker: Lune
line: Your older friend is a gestral?

speaker: Verso
line: Yes, we’ve been friends for as long as I can remember.

speaker: Lune
line: Gustave would have loved that.

speaker: Verso
line: Why? Because he liked Gestrals?

speaker: Lune
line: Because… he liked the idea of friendships that could last decades. We don’t get to enjoy such long friendships in Lumière.

speaker: Maelle
line: How come Monoco lives so far from the other gestrals?

speaker: Verso
line: Monoco’s a “Searcher.” They travel the land looking for Gestrals who went missing after the Fracture.

speaker: Maelle
line: The Lost Gestrals.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah. That, and he pissed off Golgra.

speaker: Sciel
line: What’re you working on?

speaker: Lune
line: Contingency plans. If we fail, Expedition 32 will need every bit of information we have.

speaker: Sciel
line: Right, but how’re you gonna get it to them?

speaker: Lune
line: I asked the Gestrals for help.

speaker: Sciel
line: Smart.

speaker: Lune
line: What are the stars whispering to you?

speaker: Sciel
line: Actually, I’m the one whispering to them.

speaker: Lune
line: Oh?

speaker: Sciel
line: It’s something my dad and I used to do. When I was scared or anxious, or even when I was happy. He’d say… “share it with the stars… When it’s hard to talk about things… The stars’ll understand.”

speaker: Lune
line: I like that.

speaker: Sciel
line: I talked to the stars a lot, after he was gone.

speaker: Lune
line: I remember. The night we first met. At the Crooked Tower.

speaker: Sciel
line: Right. After the Gommage.

speaker: Lune
line: I was surprised to find you here. I thought I was the only one who knew about that room.

speaker: Sciel
line: I had to go away from the harbour. And those damn petals everywhere. So I climbed up.

speaker: Lune
line: It wasn’t logical, but part of me really believed my parents and their expedition had succeeded. That they’d stopped Her. Then the Paintress woke. And I knew they weren’t coming home.

speaker: Sciel
line: You know, it meant a lot to me, the comfort we shared that day. But you avoided me after. Why?

speaker: Lune
line: I- It wasn’t personal. I- I cut a lot of people out of my life.

speaker: Sciel
line: Ok. Not personal.

speaker: Lune
line: That day, I knew my parents had failed. They were counting on me to finish their work. I couldn’t afford distractions.

speaker: Sciel
line: Friends are not distractions.

speaker: Lune
line: I know that now.

speaker: Sciel
line: Well. We’re in the middle of nowhere with one year left to live. What better time to build friendships?

speaker: Lune
line: Mm, I could use some wine though.

speaker: Sciel
line: Making friends is thirsty work.
